00067 // Deprecated library function hell. Compilers want to use the
00068 // new safe versions. This probably doesn't fully address the problem,
00069 // but it gets closer. There are too many compilers for me to fully
00070 // test. If you get compilation troubles, undefine TIXML_SAFE
00071 
00072 #define TIXML_SAFE      // TinyXml isn't fully buffer overrun protected, safe code. This is work in progress.
00073 #ifdef TIXML_SAFE
00074     #if defined(_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER >= 1200 )
00075         // Microsoft visual studio, version 6 and higher.
00076         //#pragma message( "Using _sn* functions." )
00077         #define TIXML_SNPRINTF _snprintf
00078         #define TIXML_SNSCANF  _snscanf
00079     #elif defined(__GNUC__) && (__GNUC__ >= 3 )
00080         // GCC version 3 and higher.s
00081         //#warning( "Using sn* functions." )
00082         #define TIXML_SNPRINTF snprintf
00083         #define TIXML_SNSCANF  snscanf
00084     #endif
00085 #endif

00100 /*  Internal structure for tracking location of items 
00101     in the XML file.
00102 */
00103 struct TiXmlCursor
00104 {
00105     TiXmlCursor()       { Clear(); }
00106     void Clear()        { row = col = -1; }
00107 
00108     int row;    // 0 based.
00109     int col;    // 0 based.
00110 };

00267     /*  Reads text. Returns a pointer past the given end tag.
00268         Wickedly complex options, but it keeps the (sensitive) code in one place.
00269     */
00270     static const char* ReadText(    const char* in,             // where to start
00271                                     TIXML_STRING* text,         // the string read
00272                                     bool ignoreWhiteSpace,      // whether to keep the white space
00273                                     const char* endTag,         // what ends this text
00274                                     bool ignoreCase,            // whether to ignore case in the end tag

00276 
00277     // If an entity has been found, transform it into a character.
00278     static const char* GetEntity( const char* in, char* value, int* length, TiXmlEncoding encoding );
00279 
00280     // Get a character, while interpreting entities.
00281     // The length can be from 0 to 4 bytes.
00282     inline static const char* GetChar( const char* p, char* _value, int* length, TiXmlEncoding encoding )
00283     {
00284         assert( p );
00285         if ( encoding == TIXML_ENCODING_UTF8 )
00286         {
00287             *length = utf8ByteTable[ *((unsigned char*)p) ];
00288             assert( *length >= 0 && *length < 5 );
00289         }
00290         else
00291         {
00292             *length = 1;
00293         }
00294 
00295         if ( *length == 1 )
00296         {
00297             if ( *p == '&' )
00298                 return GetEntity( p, _value, length, encoding );
00299             *_value = *p;
00300             return p+1;
00301         }
00302         else if ( *length )
00303         {
00304             //strncpy( _value, p, *length );    // lots of compilers don't like this function (unsafe),
00305                                                 // and the null terminator isn't needed
00306             for( int i=0; p[i] && i<*length; ++i ) {
00307                 _value[i] = p[i];
00308             }
00309             return p + (*length);
00310         }
00311         else
00312         {
00313             // Not valid text.
00314             return 0;
00315         }
00316     }
00317 
00318     // Puts a string to a stream, expanding entities as it goes.
00319     // Note this should not contian the '<', '>', etc, or they will be transformed into entities!
00320     static void PutString( const TIXML_STRING& str, TIXML_OSTREAM* out );

00322     static void PutString( const TIXML_STRING& str, TIXML_STRING* out );

00325     // Ignore case only works for english, and should only be relied on when comparing
00326     // to English words: StringEqual( p, "version", true ) is fine.
00327     static bool StringEqual(    const char* p,
00328                                 const char* endTag,
00329                                 bool ignoreCase,
00330                                 TiXmlEncoding encoding );

00339     // None of these methods are reliable for any language except English.
00340     // Good for approximation, not great for accuracy.
00341     static int IsAlpha( unsigned char anyByte, TiXmlEncoding encoding );
00342     static int IsAlphaNum( unsigned char anyByte, TiXmlEncoding encoding );
00343     inline static int ToLower( int v, TiXmlEncoding encoding )
00344     {
00345         if ( encoding == TIXML_ENCODING_UTF8 )
00346         {
00347             if ( v < 128 ) return tolower( v );
00348             return v;
00349         }
00350         else
00351         {
00352             return tolower( v );
00353         }
00354     }
00355     static void ConvertUTF32ToUTF8( unsigned long input, char* output, int* length );
00356

00359     void operator=( const TiXmlBase& base );    // not allowed.

00696 class TiXmlAttribute : public TiXmlBase
00697 {
00698     friend class TiXmlAttributeSet;
00699 
00700 public:
00702     TiXmlAttribute() : TiXmlBase()
00703     {
00704         document = 0;
00705         prev = next = 0;
00706     }
00707 
00708     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
00709 
00710     TiXmlAttribute( const std::string& _name, const std::string& _value )
00711     {
00712         name = _name;
00713         value = _value;
00714         document = 0;
00715         prev = next = 0;
00716     }
00717     #endif
00718 
00720     TiXmlAttribute( const char * _name, const char * _value )
00721     {
00722         name = _name;
00723         value = _value;
00724         document = 0;
00725         prev = next = 0;
00726     }
00727 
00728     const char*     Name()  const       { return name.c_str (); }       
00729     const char*     Value() const       { return value.c_str (); }      
00730     int             IntValue() const;                                   
00731     double          DoubleValue() const;                                
00732 
00742     int QueryIntValue( int* _value ) const;
00744     int QueryDoubleValue( double* _value ) const;
00745 
00746     void SetName( const char* _name )   { name = _name; }               
00747     void SetValue( const char* _value ) { value = _value; }             
00748 
00749     void SetIntValue( int _value );                                     
00750     void SetDoubleValue( double _value );                               
00751 
00752     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
00753 
00754     void SetName( const std::string& _name )    
00755     {   
00756         StringToBuffer buf( _name );
00757         SetName ( buf.buffer ? buf.buffer : "error" );  
00758     }
00760     void SetValue( const std::string& _value )  
00761     {   
00762         StringToBuffer buf( _value );
00763         SetValue( buf.buffer ? buf.buffer : "error" );  
00764     }
00765     #endif
00766 
00768     const TiXmlAttribute* Next() const;
00769     TiXmlAttribute* Next();
00771     const TiXmlAttribute* Previous() const;
00772     TiXmlAttribute* Previous();
00773 
00774     bool operator==( const TiXmlAttribute& rhs ) const { return rhs.name == name; }
00775     bool operator<( const TiXmlAttribute& rhs )  const { return name < rhs.name; }
00776     bool operator>( const TiXmlAttribute& rhs )  const { return name > rhs.name; }
00777 
00778     /*  Attribute parsing starts: first letter of the name
00779                          returns: the next char after the value end quote
00780     */
00781     virtual const char* Parse( const char* p, TiXmlParsingData* data, TiXmlEncoding encoding );
00782 
00783     // Prints this Attribute to a FILE stream.
00784     virtual void Print( FILE* cfile, int depth ) const;
00785 
00786     virtual void StreamOut( TIXML_OSTREAM * out ) const;
00787     // [internal use]
00788     // Set the document pointer so the attribute can report errors.
00789     void SetDocument( TiXmlDocument* doc )  { document = doc; }
00790 
00791 private:
00792     TiXmlAttribute( const TiXmlAttribute& );                // not implemented.
00793     void operator=( const TiXmlAttribute& base );   // not allowed.
00794 
00795     TiXmlDocument*  document;   // A pointer back to a document, for error reporting.
00796     TIXML_STRING name;
00797     TIXML_STRING value;
00798     TiXmlAttribute* prev;
00799     TiXmlAttribute* next;
00800 };

00802 
00803 /*  A class used to manage a group of attributes.
00804     It is only used internally, both by the ELEMENT and the DECLARATION.
00805     
00806     The set can be changed transparent to the Element and Declaration
00807     classes that use it, but NOT transparent to the Attribute
00808     which has to implement a next() and previous() method. Which makes
00809     it a bit problematic and prevents the use of STL.
00810 
00811     This version is implemented with circular lists because:
00812         - I like circular lists
00813         - it demonstrates some independence from the (typical) doubly linked list.
00814 */
00815 class TiXmlAttributeSet
00816 {
00817 public:
00818     TiXmlAttributeSet();
00819     ~TiXmlAttributeSet();
00820 
00821     void Add( TiXmlAttribute* attribute );
00822     void Remove( TiXmlAttribute* attribute );
00823 
00824     const TiXmlAttribute* First()   const   { return ( sentinel.next == &sentinel ) ? 0 : sentinel.next; }
00825     TiXmlAttribute* First()                 { return ( sentinel.next == &sentinel ) ? 0 : sentinel.next; }
00826     const TiXmlAttribute* Last() const      { return ( sentinel.prev == &sentinel ) ? 0 : sentinel.prev; }
00827     TiXmlAttribute* Last()                  { return ( sentinel.prev == &sentinel ) ? 0 : sentinel.prev; }
00828 
00829     const TiXmlAttribute*   Find( const char * name ) const;
00830     TiXmlAttribute* Find( const char * name );
00831 
00832 private:
00833     //*ME:  Because of hidden/disabled copy-construktor in TiXmlAttribute (sentinel-element),
00834     //*ME:  this class must be also use a hidden/disabled copy-constructor !!!
00835     TiXmlAttributeSet( const TiXmlAttributeSet& );  // not allowed
00836     void operator=( const TiXmlAttributeSet& ); // not allowed (as TiXmlAttribute)
00837 
00838     TiXmlAttribute sentinel;
00839 };

00883 
00891     int QueryIntAttribute( const char* name, int* _value ) const;
00893     int QueryDoubleAttribute( const char* name, double* _value ) const;
00895     int QueryFloatAttribute( const char* name, float* _value ) const {
00896         double d;
00897         int result = QueryDoubleAttribute( name, &d );
00898         if ( result == TIXML_SUCCESS ) {
00899             *_value = (float)d;
00900         }
00901         return result;
00902     }
00903 
00907     void SetAttribute( const char* name, const char * _value );
00908

00912     const char* Attribute( const std::string& name, double* d ) const   { return Attribute( name.c_str(), d ); }

00914     int QueryDoubleAttribute( const std::string& name, double* _value ) const { return QueryDoubleAttribute( name.c_str(), _value ); }
00915 
00917     void SetAttribute( const std::string& name, const std::string& _value ) 
00918     {   
00919         StringToBuffer n( name );
00920         StringToBuffer v( _value );
00921         if ( n.buffer && v.buffer )
00922             SetAttribute (n.buffer, v.buffer ); 
00923     }   
00925     void SetAttribute( const std::string& name, int _value )    
00926     {   
00927         StringToBuffer n( name );
00928         if ( n.buffer )
00929             SetAttribute (n.buffer, _value);    
00930     }   
00931     #endif
00932 
00936     void SetAttribute( const char * name, int value );

00948     #endif

00952     const TiXmlAttribute* LastAttribute()   const   { return attributeSet.Last(); }     
00953     TiXmlAttribute* LastAttribute()                 { return attributeSet.Last(); }

01252 
01253     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
01254     bool LoadFile( const std::string& filename, TiXmlEncoding encoding = TIXML_DEFAULT_ENCODING )           
01255     {
01256         StringToBuffer f( filename );
01257         return ( f.buffer && LoadFile( f.buffer, encoding ));
01258     }
01259     bool SaveFile( const std::string& filename ) const      
01260     {
01261         StringToBuffer f( filename );
01262         return ( f.buffer && SaveFile( f.buffer ));
01263     }
01264     #endif

01277     TiXmlElement* RootElement()                 { return FirstChildElement(); }

01293 
01301     int ErrorRow()  { return errorLocation.row+1; }
01302     int ErrorCol()  { return errorLocation.col+1; }

01328     void SetTabSize( int _tabsize )     { tabsize = _tabsize; }
01329 
01330     int TabSize() const { return tabsize; }
01331 
01335     void ClearError()                       {   error = false; 
01336                                                 errorId = 0; 
01337                                                 errorDesc = ""; 
01338                                                 errorLocation.row = errorLocation.col = 0; 
01339                                                 //errorLocation.last = 0; 
01340                                             }

01343     void Print() const                      { Print( stdout, 0 ); }

01356     #endif

01450 class TiXmlHandle
01451 {
01452 public:
01454     TiXmlHandle( TiXmlNode* _node )                 { this->node = _node; }
01456     TiXmlHandle( const TiXmlHandle& ref )           { this->node = ref.node; }
01457     TiXmlHandle operator=( const TiXmlHandle& ref ) { this->node = ref.node; return *this; }
01458 
01460     TiXmlHandle FirstChild() const;
01462     TiXmlHandle FirstChild( const char * value ) const;
01464     TiXmlHandle FirstChildElement() const;
01466     TiXmlHandle FirstChildElement( const char * value ) const;
01467 
01471     TiXmlHandle Child( const char* value, int index ) const;
01475     TiXmlHandle Child( int index ) const;
01480     TiXmlHandle ChildElement( const char* value, int index ) const;
01485     TiXmlHandle ChildElement( int index ) const;
01486 
01487     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
01488     TiXmlHandle FirstChild( const std::string& _value ) const               { return FirstChild( _value.c_str() ); }
01489     TiXmlHandle FirstChildElement( const std::string& _value ) const        { return FirstChildElement( _value.c_str() ); }
01490 
01491     TiXmlHandle Child( const std::string& _value, int index ) const         { return Child( _value.c_str(), index ); }
01492     TiXmlHandle ChildElement( const std::string& _value, int index ) const  { return ChildElement( _value.c_str(), index ); }
01493     #endif
01494 
01496     TiXmlNode* Node() const         { return node; } 
01498     TiXmlElement* Element() const   { return ( ( node && node->ToElement() ) ? node->ToElement() : 0 ); }
01500     TiXmlText* Text() const         { return ( ( node && node->ToText() ) ? node->ToText() : 0 ); }
01502     TiXmlUnknown* Unknown() const           { return ( ( node && node->ToUnknown() ) ? node->ToUnknown() : 0 ); }
01503 
01504 private:
01505     TiXmlNode* node;
01506 };
